\title{Sphinx Documentation Template: Quick Guide}
\date{Jun 13, 2025}
\release{}
\author{}

\renewcommand{\releasename}{}

\begin{document}

\pagestyle{plain}
\sphinxtableofcontents
\pagestyle{normal}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\headerlogo
\thetitle


\chapter{Introduction}
\label{\detokenize{index:introduction}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This \sphinxstylestrong{single\sphinxhyphen{}pg guide} provides a concise overview of how to build documentation using this Sphinx template.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Unlike the full \sphinxstylestrong{multi\sphinxhyphen{}pgs}, this version is optimized for quick reference and generates a \sphinxstylestrong{single\sphinxhyphen{}page HTML or PDF}. Itâ€™s ideal for handouts, simple walkthroughs, or embedded documentation in other platforms.


\chapter{Repository Highlights}
\label{\detokenize{index:repository-highlights}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This documentation system is built with:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{Sphinx} + \sphinxtitleref{sphinx\_rtd\_theme}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Custom LaTeX preamble and title page

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Support for both multi\sphinxhyphen{}page and single\sphinxhyphen{}page formats

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Configurable output: HTML and PDF

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Easy\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}use Makefile automation

\end{itemize}


\chapter{Quick Start}
\label{\detokenize{index:quick-start}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Install Sphinx and dependencies:}

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }sphinx\PYG{+w}{ }sphinx\PYGZus{}rtd\PYGZus{}theme
sudo\PYG{+w}{ }apt\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }lualatex\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} For PDF (Linux only)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{1}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Generate HTML:}

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
make\PYG{+w}{ }single\PYGZhy{}page\PYGZhy{}html
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{2}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Generate PDF:}

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
make\PYG{+w}{ }single\PYGZhy{}page\PYGZhy{}pdf
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Directory Layout}
\label{\detokenize{index:directory-layout}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{single\sphinxhyphen{}page/}: Contains this quick guide (\sphinxtitleref{quick\sphinxhyphen{}index.rst})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{\_preamble/}: LaTeX settings for PDF rendering

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{\_figs/}, \sphinxtitleref{\_fonts/}: Assets and fonts

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{output\sphinxhyphen{}dir/single\sphinxhyphen{}page/}: Output folder for generated HTML and PDF

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For full instructions and advanced configuration, refer to the file \sphinxstylestrong{multi\sphinxhyphen{}pgs.pdf}.
